channel.title: Complete port forwarding guide. to stop the questions!
channel.description:
[size=20pt]To Stop The Questions About Port Forwarding[/size]
1) first get a static ip. go here to learn how to get a static ip, and forward the static ip and the port to ur router or local internet connection. which u got. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jBvVCAPXsDA 2)second, lower all your firewalls, on anti virus's too. because firewalls make it difficult for people to get on ur game. 3) accept port 43594 on your firewall. depending on what platform u got its different. for windows xp u gotta go to firewall settings then accept port numba 43594. 4) then do all the no-ip shtuff u do and ur done[br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 15, 2008, 10:38:38 PM[/size][hr]post when you succsessfully port forward

item.title: Complete port forwarding guide. to stop the questions!
item.dc:creator: @gobabygo6 gobabygo6
item.description:
@gobabygo6 wrote:

[size=20pt]To Stop The Questions About Port Forwarding[/size]

  1. first get a static ip. go here to learn how to get a static ip, and forward the static ip and the port to ur router or local internet connection. which u got. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jBvVCAPXsDA
    2)second, lower all your firewalls, on anti virus’s too. because firewalls make it difficult for people to get on ur game.
  2. accept port 43594 on your firewall. depending on what platform u got its different. for windows xp u gotta go to firewall settings then accept port numba 43594.
  3. then do all the no-ip shtuff u do and ur done[br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 15, 2008, 10:38:38 PM[/size][hr]post when you succsessfully port forward
